'''Princess Disa''' is the wife of [[Durin IV|Prince Durin IV]]. Disa was invented for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' by [[Amazon Studios]], where she is portrayed by [[Sophia Nomvete]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9788618/fullcredits|articlename=Full Cast & Crew|dated=|website=IMDB|accessed=1 August 2022}}</ref>

== History ==
When Disa reminded [[Durin IV]] how he will inherit [[Khazad-dûm]] from [[Durin III|his father]], Durin IV remarked that it was just another reason to count his blessings, before reminiscing on how he married her and not [[Margid Rustborin]].<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://twitter.com/PrimeVideo/status/1562862442148798466|articlename=Meet Prince Durin IV and Princess Disa in #TheRingsOfPower.|dated=|website=Twitter|accessed=25 August 2022}}</ref>

== Controversy ==
Disa was the first female dwarf revealed from the show and she was portrayed with little facial hair. Some fans took offense because they believed [[Dwarf-women]] have full beards.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://screenrant.com/lord-rings-power-female-dwarf-disa-beard-backlash-lore/|articlename=LOTR Beard Controversy Explained|dated=15 February 2022|website=Screen Rant|accessed=7 August 2022}}</ref> Sophia Nomvete responded to this, explaining that Disa does have facial hair, although it is less prominent than most male dwarves, as she only has sideburns.<ref>{{webcite|author=Devan Coggan|articleurl=https://ew.com/tv/lord-of-the-rings-the-rings-of-power-character-guide/|articlename=Meet 13 key characters from The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power
|dated=2 August 2022|website=Entertainment Weekly|accessed=19 August 2022}}</ref>
